creator: camsmith@scoteq.co.uk
text:
Could not compile package on JDK1.1.7 or 1.1.8.
On inspection, the culprint was: org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppenderBeanInfo 
no-args constructor.

This calls two undefined methods on class java.beans.Introspector: getBeanInfo
(Class, int) and flushFromCaches(Class).  It also references an undefined 
constant: Introspector.IGNORE_ALL_BEAN_INFO.

The package is fine on JDK1.3, therefore I suspect this is a JDK version 
problem.  log4j claims to be JDK1.1 compatible, though!

creator: carsten@frewert.de
text:
java.beans.Introspector#getBeanInfo(Class, int) seems to appear first 
in the API docs of Java 1.2.
It does definitely not exist in Java-1.1.8 or earlier versions.
The same applies to Introspector#IGNORE_ALL_BEAN_INFO and 
Introspector#flushFromCaches(Class).
However, I cannot find anything like a ChangeLog about this in the 
current API specification.

creator: carsten@frewert.de
text:
FYI: The missing @since tags in the java.beans.* documentation are added
     to Sun's BugParade with the ID 4513840.

creator: ceki@apache.org
text:
This particular problem in JDK 1.1.3 has been fixed in log4j 1.2.
However, you need JDK 1.2 to compile log4j but not to run it.
